bibl.title: Letter from Harry L. Freer to Philip Showalter Hench, February 20, 1941

div1.p: Freer informs Hench that no record of a map of Camp Columbia made in 1900 or 1901 could be found. He will send Hench two additional maps prepared in 1902 and 1907.

div1.head: Letter from Harry L. Freer to Philip Showalter Hench, February 20, 1941
div1.opener:
ADDRESS REPLY TO
CHIEF OF ENGINEERS, U.S. ARMY
WASHINGTON, D. C.
REFER TO FILE NO. 314.7-1551
7-C
WAR DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE CHIEF OF ENGINEERS
WASHINGTON
February 20, 1941.
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
The receipt is acknowledged, by reference from
the Adjutant General's Office, of your letter of January 29,
1941, requesting a map of Camp Columbia as of 1900 or 1901,
also an additional copy of the 1907 map made under the
direction of Major M. M. Patrick, Corps of Engineers.

A thorough search has been made of all material
now in this office and no record has been found of a map
of Camp Columbia made in 1900 or 1901.

I am pleased to furnish in duplicate a copy of
a map of Columbia Barracks Reservation, made in 1902, which
is on a larger scale than the one previously furnished you.

There is also furnished, under separate cover,
an additional copy of the 1907 map you requested together
with a key to the numbered buildings.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Harry L. Freer,
Chief Clerk. Inclosures:
Under Separate Cover.
